skillTree.localised_description: Regular consumption of rotten meat and toxins are the staples of a healthy Ogre diet.
As menial slaves to the Butcher's bidding, these Gnoblars must find him meat for the pot, or wind up in it themselves.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.
It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Bannaga is well known for his incredibly short temper and his loud voice induced by deafness. These two traits combined make him reckless on the battlefield.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Many Ogres would gladly sell their services to any who would be willing to pay. Bannaga in particular is known for fighting alongside the humans of Grand Cathay and the Kingdoms of Ind. As a result, many Ogres come to these lands, hungry for fame and riches or even a chance to fight alongside the legendary Bannaga.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for all mercenary Ogres
	(Hero's army)
Allegiance points: +10% for alliances with Ogres

Upkeep: -10% for all mercenary Ogres
	(Hero's army)
Allegiance points: +20% for alliances with Ogres

Upkeep: -15% for all mercenary Ogres
	(Hero's army)
Allegiance points: +30% for alliances with Ogres

skillTree.localised_description: The ruler of Shang Yang and the Western Provinces, Zhao Ming, is the only ruler in Cathay that will house Ogres, although under one condition: they must be taught restraint and civilised. Not even a respected mercenary such as Bannaga is exempt from this law.

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

skillTree.localised_description: Bannaga carries a pouch filled with meat for a little mid-battle snack.

Development of advanced ammunition for the Bangstick makes this already formidable weapon even more deadly. Packaging gunpowder and warpstone together in a paper shell both enhances the weapon’s destructive power and reduces reload time.

Most Ogres don’t hold the lives of Gnoblars in much regard, for they sit at the bottom of the hierarchy of Ogre society. Bannaga in particular holds Gnoblars in total contempt, often feasting on any who dare enter his vicinity.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Butchers are said to be able to commune directly with the Ogre deity, The Great Maw, lending them great respect with other Ogre tribes.
The spellcaster unleashes the beast within, using its fury to transform allies into bestial forms.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Wyssan's Wildform"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Wyssan's Wildform Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Wyssan's Wildform Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster attunes the magic of the wild, channelling its ancient and arcane power.
With a mighty bellow, the caster invokes Corvus the Crow Lord, summoning his servants to peck at the foe's eyes.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flock of Doom"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Flock of Doom Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flock of Doom Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Calling upon the beast spirits of the wild, the caster sheathes vulnerable flesh in unyielding fur and hide.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Pann's Impenetrable Pelt"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Pann's Impenetrable Pelt Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pann's Impenetrable Pelt Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Sounding a gnarled horn, the caster summons a glowing amber spear and hurls it at the foe with uncanny accuracy.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Amber Spear"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Amber Spear Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Amber Spear Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Once the slaughter begins, every foe is but meat yet to be carved.
Kadon, a master of forms, was able to shift his shape into anything he chose. This mastery is used to summon a Manticore, as if Kadon himself fights for you.

ui_effects.localised_text: Spawned unit fights in this battle only
Spawned unit fights in this battle only

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -6 for "Transformation of Kadon"

skillTree.localised_description: Nebulous nature spirits assail the foe, clawing at them with hands not nearly as insubstantial as they appear.

effects.description: Overcast spell: "The Curse of Anraheir Upgraded"
Overcast spell: "The Curse of Anraheir Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Curse of Anraheir"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Curse of Anraheir Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Curse of Anraheir Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
Where this one goes, his meat-pot goes too, as a bounteous reserve for his spells.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: Never one to run with the crowd, this one likes to sneak about in front by themselves and surprise the foe – which isn't necessarily an easy thing to do when you're an Ogre!

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: A truly sturdy armour is needed to hold such an overflowing gut in place.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Death is always just a shot away.
"It's got a few secret ingredients. No, I won't tell you what they are, but the results will speak for themselves."
"Get more ammo up here, NOW!!!!!!!!"
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
"You're a big git, but you're in bad shape. For me, it's a full-time job – now behave yourself."
"Stay in one place, gods-damn you!"
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
A clever arrangement of lenses makes the target seem just that bit closer.
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

effects.description: Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 3%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 6%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 9%

skillTree.localised_description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 1
Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 2
Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 3%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 6%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit can fire while on the move.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

items.colour_text: A thunderous gun as loud as its creator, the Bangstick’s explosive ammo decimates ranks of infantry with ease.

A seemingly normal Straw Hat, given to Bannaga as a gift from the village elder of Tai Tzu for repelling a Skaven invasion. In truth, the Hat is enchanted with magical properties, shielding the wearer with a spectral barrier.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Bannaga is an Ogre Butcher well known in the lands of Cathay and Ind for offering local rulers and nobles his services, most of which involve killing.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead
Cooldown: -30% to Lore of Beasts spells
